keynote.translation[0].definitions[0].de: the main point in a book, system of beliefs, activity etc that influences everything else
keynote.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Unprecedented change has been the keynote of the electronic revolution.
keynote.translation[1].definitions[0].de: relating to the most important part of a formal meeting, report etc
keynote.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: Bill Gates is booked as the keynote speaker.
He is scheduled to deliver the keynote address at an awards ceremony.
keynote.translation[2].definitions[0].de: to give the keynote speech at a formal meeting, ceremony etc
keynote.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: The event is usually keynoted by the prime minister.
keynote.translation[3].definitions[0].de: the most important speech at a large meeting
keynote.translation[3].definitions[0].ex: A question-and-answer session followed the Chancellorâ€™s keynote speech at the CBI conference.
